bcbioSingleCell
  • Reference
  • News

Top Barcodes

Top Barcodes

topBarcodes(object, ...)

# S4 method for bcbioSingleCell
topBarcodes(object, n = 10)

# S4 method for seurat
topBarcodes(object, n = 10)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments (for the S4 generic definition).
n

Number of barcodes to return per sample.

Value

data.frame

See also

Other Clustering Utilities: knownMarkersDetected, plotKnownMarkers, plotMarkers, plotPCElbow, plotTopMarkers, topMarkers

Examples

load(system.file(
    file.path("extdata", "bcb.rda"),
    package = "bcbioSingleCell"))
load(system.file(
    file.path("extdata", "seurat.rda"),
    package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

# bcbioSingleCell
topBarcodes(bcb) %>% glimpse()
#> Observations: 10
#> Variables: 16
#> $ sampleID            <fctr> run1_AGAGGATA, run1_AGAGGATA, run1_AGAGGATA, r...
#> $ nUMI                <dbl> 14095, 14053, 13083, 12909, 12660, 12541, 12359...
#> $ nGene               <int> 4230, 4146, 3623, 3916, 4275, 4108, 3891, 3991,...
#> $ nCoding             <dbl> 12405, 11895, 12101, 11533, 11627, 11527, 11261...
#> $ nMito               <dbl> 781, 1251, 324, 476, 410, 482, 338, 494, 239, 213
#> $ log10GenesPerUMI    <dbl> 0.8740139, 0.8721868, 0.8645425, 0.8739812, 0.8...
#> $ mitoRatio           <dbl> 0.05540972, 0.08902014, 0.02476496, 0.03687350,...
#> $ nCount              <int> 128690, 126962, 111183, 118717, 120160, 110058,...
#> $ sampleName          <fctr> M1_seq_rep_1, M1_seq_rep_1, M1_seq_rep_1, M1_s...
#> $ description         <fctr> run1, run1, run1, run1, run1, run1, run1, run1...
#> $ fileName            <fctr> 20170915_Pool_ZG4780-1_S1_R1_001.fastq.gz, 201...
#> $ index               <fctr> 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2
#> $ sequence            <fctr> TATCCTCT, TATCCTCT, TATCCTCT, TATCCTCT, TATCCT...
#> $ sampleNameAggregate <fctr> M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1
#> $ revcomp             <fctr> AGAGGATA, AGAGGATA, AGAGGATA, AGAGGATA, AGAGGA...
#> $ interestingGroups   <fctr> M1_seq_rep_1, M1_seq_rep_1, M1_seq_rep_1, M1_s...

# seurat
topBarcodes(seurat) %>% glimpse()
#> Observations: 10
#> Variables: 13
#> $ nGene             <int> 4389, 4529, 4198, 3876, 4618, 4349, 4154, 4306, 3...
#> $ nUMI              <dbl> 25701, 25668, 23549, 23296, 23096, 22609, 22289, ...
#> $ sampleID          <fctr> M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1
#> $ nCoding           <dbl> 21722, 22632, 21039, 21571, 21225, 20764, 20358, ...
#> $ nMito             <dbl> 2334, 1430, 889, 584, 771, 885, 624, 902, 444, 396
#> $ log10GenesPerUMI  <dbl> 0.8259426, 0.8291398, 0.8286974, 0.8216516, 0.839...
#> $ mitoRatio         <dbl> 0.09081359, 0.05571139, 0.03775107, 0.02506868, 0...
#> $ nCount            <int> 219262, 224684, 206429, 191688, 208700, 189441, 2...
#> $ sampleName        <fctr> M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1
#> $ description       <fctr> M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1
#> $ origIdent         <fctr> M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1
#> $ res08             <fctr> 3, 3, 3, 1, 3, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1
#> $ interestingGroups <fctr> M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1, M1
